t: Punishment Coming for Israel and Judah
Hear*pn this, O priests! Pay*ld attention, O house of Israel! Give*ln ear, O house of the king! For*ld the judgment is for you; for*ln you have been a snare at Mizpah and*ld a net spread upon Tabor.
And*ln the revolters have gone deep into slaughter, but*ld I will discipline all of them.
I*pn know Ephraim, and*ld Israel is not hidden from me; for*ln now, O Ephraim, you have played the whore; Israel*ld is defiled.
Their*ln deeds do not permit them to*ld return to their God. For*ln the spirit of whoredom is within them, and*ld they know not the Lord.*s
The*pn pride of Israel testifies to his face; Israel*ld and Ephraim shall stumble in his guilt; Judah*ld also shall stumble with them.
With*ln their flocks and herds they shall go to*ld seek the Lord,*s but*ln they will not find him; he*ld has withdrawn from them.
They*ln have dealt faithlessly with the Lord;*s for*ld they have borne alien children. Now*ld the new moon shall devour them with their fields.
Blow*pn the horn in Gibeah, the*ld trumpet in Ramah. Sound*ln the alarm at Beth-aven; we*ld follow you, O Benjamin!
Ephraim*ln shall become a desolation in*ld the day of punishment; among*ln the tribes of Israel I*ld make known what is sure.
The*ln princes of Judah have become like*ld those who move the landmark; upon*ln them I will pour out my*ld wrath like water.
Ephraim*ln is oppressed, crushed in judgment, because*ld he was determined to go after filth.
But*ln I am like a moth to Ephraim, and*ld like dry rot to the house of Judah.
When*pn Ephraim saw his sickness, and*ld Judah his wound, then*ln Ephraim went to Assyria, and*ld sent to the great king. But*ln he is not able to cure you or*ld heal your wound.
For*ln I will be like a lion to Ephraim, and*ld like a young lion to the house of Judah. I,*ln even I, will tear and go away; I*ld will carry off, and no one shall rescue.
I*pn will return again to my place, until*ld they acknowledge their guilt and seek my face, and*ld in their distress earnestly seek me.
